result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S Otto was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$500.00 cash bond to be applied towards Court costs.
Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew S Otto

Prior: 2133 3 1/2 Ave, Chetek, WI 54728 United States

Defendant Matthew S Otto in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM264 and 15CM272 called.  Attorney Sutton recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

15CM264 Amend to County Disorderly Conduct 9.01 - Granted.  No contest plea entered.

15CM272 Guilty plea

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney Sutton relates.  Court relates and orders:

15CM264 $267.50 forf - 60 DTP

15CM272 Court costs including surcharges - 60 DTP

Apply cash bond to both cases

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court - To report to jail on Thursday, November 12, 2015 between 1:00 pm and 5:00 pm

(clerked by AP)
Defendant Matthew S Otto in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORDE COVERS 15CM264 AND 15CM272

Both above reset.
Bond(s) to continue  Plea hearing scheduled for November 11, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant indicates he also stays at 233 Wisconsin Ave in Chetek but still receives his mail at 2133 3 1/2 Ave in Chetek.
